page.title: 02FARMING
page.content: Winter wheat is still used as the first cereal crop sometimes being planted after potatoes, more usually after a grass ley. Winter barley then follows for one or two years. This gives a good entry to oil seed rape production. Spring barley would then be sown after a brassica crop to bring the land back into cereal cropping. There are many sheep in the area,the main bulk of which are crossbred ewes for producing fat lambs i.e.Border /Leicester, Welsh/Scotch Mules. The rams tend to be of the lowland type Suffolk or Texel.Lambing begins in mid January until March. Early lambs are sold fat on the open market the bulk are sold at specialist lamb sales. A small proportion are overwintered on catch crops of roots and sold late winter. Two flocks are wintered on sprout stems and cabbage residues.
